704762f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - Garnet Street
704762f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, north from Garnet Street. All the buildings are being demolished and the avenue will be Nreconstracted as the northerly extension of the Belt
Parkway.
See 'The New York Times," June 27, 1940, p.4.
April 9, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The clearance at the N. E. corner of Hamilton Avenue
and Garnet Street.
October 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr
704762f-a.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Garnet Street, Brooklyn, NY

704763f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - Garnet Street
704763f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, south from Garnet Street, showing the area that was clenred of all its bu'ldings for the construction of Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway. On the left is a row of tenements on the east side of Court Street; to its right is the Devoe and Rnynolds paint factory on the
Gowanus Canal, near the bridge.
View 2 is south from Centre Street.
View 1: October 23, 1940
View 2: September 7, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO RI3P2TNN1ONS
704763f-a.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Garnet Street, Brooklyn, NY
